intro: Fissistigma hypoglaucum, commonly known as the smoothleaf fissistigma, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, elliptical leaves that are typically smooth and dark green. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the wet season. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed.
